intro: Verbascum cheiranthifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mullein, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late summer, which are clustered in a cylindrical spike. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
